title: I've been interested in studying at some UK universities but some of them aren't recognized by WES credential evaluations. Is there another evaluation body who would recognize that education? - Quora
tags: Higher Education in the United Kingdom
Colleges and Universities in the United Kingdom

response.answer_text: Are you sure these are genuine UK universities? WES says that “If your own country does not recognize the institution or program, then WES cannot evaluate the institution or program”. I would be surprised if, as a reputable credential evaluation agency, they refused to recognise any legitimate UK universities. Legitimate UK degree awarding bodies can be found at Check if a university or college is officially recognised or via Search for a university or college.

I have no idea what WES is supposed to be. All that you need to check is that the university has a Royal Charter (meaning that Her Majesty the Queen personally endorses the quality of its teaching and research) and that the department in which you would be studying earned a high score in the most recent Research Excellence Framework (meaning that it is respected by comparable departments around the world).

I very much doubt that any institution in the UK whose name includes the world University is no recognized by WES. Perhaps you are looking at private colleges that tutor students for the degrees of other universities?
